note.p: Death: York Place, Candie Road, Guernsey (12 October 1888)
Education: Topsham; Exeter; Guys' and St Thomas' Hospitals, London (qualified 1821). MD (Erlangen)

Career: Practised in Guernsey; experimented on the solubility of calculi; studied the climatology of Guernsey; published "Tables for the extemporaneous application of corrections for temperature to barometic observations" (1842); retired from medical practice (1859) and undertook historical research
Memberships: LSA (1821); MRCS (1822); LRCP Extra-urbem (1834); FRCP (1859)
